election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1800 House of Representatives, Philadelphia County, Special

overview.note: "The following are the majorities for the republican candidate, on the election of Friday last -- it appears that there has been a majority in every district for the republican candidate[sic] ... in the room of the late Thomas Mifflin, when the candidates were Matthew Huston, supported by the republican interest, Mr. Holmes by the anti-republicans." Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.
The overall majority for Matthew Huston was 1300. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Blockley and Kinsessing
sub_unit.note: The majority for Matthew Huston in Blockley and Kinsessing was 23. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Bustletown
sub_unit.note: The majority for Matthew Huston in Bustletown was 78. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Germantown
sub_unit.note: The majority for Matthew Huston in Germantown was 199. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Northern Liberties
sub_unit.note: The majority for Matthew Huston in Northern Liberties was 659. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.

sub_unit.name: Southwark
sub_unit.note: The majority for Matthew Huston in Southwark was 341. Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.
The Southwark District includes Moyamensing and Passyunk.

election_record.reference: The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). February 11, 1800.
